titleproper.value: Guide to the Records of the Reiss Center on Law and Security <num>RG.22.15</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-04-05T17:32:16</date>

unittitle.value: Records of the Reiss Center on Law and Security

abstract.value: The Reiss Center on Law and Security is a non-partison multidisciplinary research institute at NYU School of Law. Founded in 2003 as the Center on Law and Security and renamed in 2018, the center facilitates dialogue and produces research on legal, policy, and strategic issues in the field of national security. The Reiss Center holds public events, conferences, and workshops; hosts policy groups; produces research and writing in both academic and popular media; sponsors fellowships from leading experts in the field; and offers academic programs for students at NYU School of Law. This collection consists of publications issued by the Reiss Center for Law and Security, and includes reports and issue briefs concerning security law, foreign policy, military affairs, and national security strategy.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Reiss Center for Law and Security Publications; RG 22.15; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Transferred by the Reiss Center for Law and Security in March 2019; the accession number associated with this transfer is 2019.038.

The Reiss Center on Law and Security is a non-partison multidisciplinary research institute at NYU School of Law. Founded in 2003 as the Center on Law and Security and renamed in 2018, the center facilitates dialogue and produces research on legal, policy, and strategic issues in the field of national security. The Reiss Center holds public events, conferences, and workshops; hosts policy groups; produces research and writing in both academic and popular media; sponsors fellowships from leading experts in the field; and offers academic programs for students at NYU School of Law.

This collection consists of publications issued by the Reiss Center for Law and Security at the NYU School of Law. Materials include reports and issue briefs concerning security law, foreign policy, military affairs, and national security strategy.

corpname.value: New York University. School of Law
